intro: Carum dolichopodum, commonly known as slender caraway, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
